messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:16): wants the HTML5 state machine poster to be drawn by the xkcd guy
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:17): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Randall Munroe.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:23): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Yeah I know but it is more fun to say "the xkcd guy" (and I guess more accessible)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:23): Makes sense.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (22:24): there's http://canvex.lazyilluminati.com/misc/states10.png but it's out of date
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:25): Holy crap.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (22:25): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: can you make a new one that's up to date?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:26): I'll bet that could be rearranged to make less line-crossing.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:27): I was pretty good at that one game where you had to rearrange nodes to create a planar graph.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:28): I don't want to put in the effort to create the initial graph, though.  If I was given something already created I'd spend the time to rearrange it.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:28): Imagine that, drawn by the xkcd guy, on our office wall
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:28): I think http://philip.html5.org/misc/tokeniser_states.png is the latest version
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:28): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: I can't, until I make loads of updates to my tokeniser
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (22:28): In unrelated news I had a bizzare dream that 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb was an oldish guy with a beard working at a supermarket checkout
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:29): I'm young and a webdev, but I do have a beard.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:29): I haven't ever dreamed about any of you guys, though.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:30): http://philip.html5.org/misc/insertion-modes-3.png
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:30): is the equivalent for the tree construction algorithm
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:31): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, one can emulate his style pretty easily ;)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:31): (Red for parse errors, blue for EOF, I think)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:31): That one's not bad, ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c.
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (22:31): has quite similiar diagrams in his notebook
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:32): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, if you are good at that game (gplanarity?), better patch graphviz, so we all wan benefit from that
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:33): Yeah, as soon as I d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920caioned it I went and googled for it.  I'm playing it right now.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:33): (All these graphs are just generated automatically from OCaml encodings of the algorithms)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:33): Just plain Planarity.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:34): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, so can i have the .dot files to experiment a bit?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:34): Is it possible to prove planarity of a graph?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:34): What do you mean by "prove planarity"?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:34): I know Planarity just generates planar graphs and then scrambles the nodes.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:35): Prove that it is possible to find a 2d embedding that is planar, or something?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:35): Prove whether the graph can be made planar, or if there *must* be an edge-crossing (or alternately, if the graph must be 3-dimensional).
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:35): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, you mean compute if a graph is planar just by having a node list, using some simple rule ?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:35): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: As long as "simple" is less than "throw a computer at it to bruteforce it", yes.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (22:35): oh, my friend John wrote planarity.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:36): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: Awesome!  Pass along my thanks.  I whiled away several hours with that.  In other news, I like untangling knots.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:37): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Planarity_testing
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:38): Ah, excellent.  I feared it might be a bad problem.  Wonderful.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:38): oh, some guy i know took planarity, dumped the level files and wrote an application for a home-built multitouch-desk
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:38): There are so many things that'll be great once surfaces get smart.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:39): If anyone's an RPG dork, there's a group writing a D&D 4e battlemat for MS's Surface.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:39): I hope they get smart enough to tell the difference between fingers and elbows and mugs

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:39): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, if you have a multitouch display, install python-libavg and try this https://www.libavg.de/svn/trunk/avg_media/mtc/planarity/
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:39): I don't, but I'll bookmark that.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:40): or otherwise, if you ever come to berlin, the local hacker space has one ;)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:40): Man, where were you guys like 4 years ago when I was in Berlin?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:40): better: one of the local hackerspaces ;)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:40): (For like 2 days, but still.)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:41): the c-base existed 4 years ago. this software did not.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:41): I'll look you up next time I hop the ocean.  ^_^
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:41): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: I don't seem to have the .dot files for the tree constructor graph
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:42): i once used graphviz to document most of the relationships at our school
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:42): That would be interesting.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:42): that is, only the publicly known
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:43): for obvious reasons
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:43): wait, i can upload it (anonymiz'd)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:43): I have an urge to write something that will let me do planarity-type manipulation on arbitrary graphs.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:44): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Hmm, but the code still compiles and produces a similar graph
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:44): Should I learn <canvas> or just do it in DOM?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:44): (Probably the latter.)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:45): I don't know SVG, though.  I'd have to learn that too.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:45): Though I *have* been meaning to learn SVG anyway.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:45): And I'm certain it can do better curvy lines.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:45): will start on it this weekend.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:46): And then I'll make your graphs all pretty-like.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:47): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Oh, whoops, I already had a .dot uploaded
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:47): http://philip.html5.org/misc/insertion-modes-3.dot
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:47): Also there's http://philip.html5.org/misc/insertion-modes-4.dot (newly generated) which is a bit different
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:47): i won't do the relationship-thingy btw. realized it isnt so anonymous after all
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (22:47): yeah, graphing relationships rulez
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (22:47): http://ibawizard.net/~thement/sapphic_map.jpg
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:49): haha d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca. mine is like that, only that the bubbles contain full names and i also denoted one-way-crush and ONS etc.
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (22:50): how did you collect data?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:50): wait, that are only girls names
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:51): Thus "sapphic"
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:51): d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca, i know pretty much about relationships, but i asked around what could be deemed as ‚Äûpublic‚Äú
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (22:51): ah, gossip-graph
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:51): didn't include for examble my best friends one night stand with some guy that only settled for her because ‚Ä¶ its a long story
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:52): no, i asked the people directly
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:52): was at a boarding school
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (22:52): and bored in class
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (23:00): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, sadly only dot produces meaningful results. too much chatter among these lines
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (23:05): nice :) http://img405.imageshack.us/img405/8049/html5dot.png
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:07): Way to kill everyone, 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:08): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: killa.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (23:08): "too much chatter", hehehe
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:15): Am I being dumb, or is there a way to unset a radio button group?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:16): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Via UI? Scripting?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:16): Scripting.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:17): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: loop over all radio buttons and set checked to false?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:17): (or maybe it's called something different)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:18): checked
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:19): Doesn't appear to work.  (I'm doing $("#foo input").removeAttr("checked").)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): Not removeAttr
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:19): Never mind, that does work.  Bug in my code, then.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:19): jQuery, silly.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): I meant the DOM attribute, not the content attribute
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): But I guess content attribute should work too
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:20): I don't usually have to understand the difference with jq, luckily.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:21): So the answer is that I was being stupid.  Forgot the # in front of #foo.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:21): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: jQuery doesn't save you from that
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:22): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: You need a better framework obviously
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:22): Obviously.  One which understands what I mean when I mistype a selector.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:22): Yeah, I mean it's AI that makes HTML error-handling awesome.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:23): Couldn't code without the cool, metallic feel of it wrapped around me.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:23): And Windows nowadays has HAL, so AI is spreading across the world!
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:24): "nowadays"?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:24): On that note, http://www.cleverbot.com/ is the best chatterbot I've ever seen.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:24): Windows NT always had HAL
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:24): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I know.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:24): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: But in terms of widely-used releases, only two releases ago.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:25): Or, in all releases within the past decade
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:25): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: What about ME?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:25): That doesn't exist
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:26): dot can output SVG
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:27): Like http://philip.html5.org/misc/insertion-modes-3.svg
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:27): but the text overlaps the lines :-(
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:28): Why don't I get scrollbars when I view that?  (In Chrome.)
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:29): because Webkit follows a part of the SVG spec that makes no sense
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:29): although I thought we got the spec changed
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:29): I see.  So I need to bug that, I suppose.
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:30): I seem to recall a bug on it, but I may be wrong
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:30): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: works for me, I guess you have different fonts. Just need to hack dot to use @font-face with a data: url
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:32): unfortunately your graph suffers from the problem that dot doesn't try to do anything to keep the aspect ratio of the graph sane
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (23:36): i figured out it would be pretty boring ‚Ä¶ http://img21.imageshack.us/img21/3418/html5.png
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:38): Damn, I'm going to have to trawl the "Make XKCD slightly worse" thread to find that font again.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:39): Btw: "macically".
